__e: I swore from that moment on, that if I could protect people, if I could save them, I wouldn't wait for permission. I would act.
Yes... but I told myself that I wouldn't do it with somebody that I didn't know really, really well.
i vowed right then that when i made something of myself, i would honor you somehow.
Swore he'd never leave it again.
And now that George has learned to balance his time, he has vowed never to be late for lunch again.
I worked with a man like that once, swore blind he was my best mate.
I vowed that someday I would escape and kill him.
And then, the third time... I told myself I would never go down that trail again.
So, I vowed there and then that I would find you and that nothing would stop me.
And that day I vowed to find the man who killed my family.
What I did today, what I almost did, I swore to do never again.
So, I vowed there and then that I would find you and that nothing would stop me.
He swore that she called him because she did call him.
He called the night he was arrested, swore he was innocent.
I swore that one tried marriage was enough, but perhaps it's time to reconsider.
I swore an oath to sacrifice my life if necessary so others may live freely, a lesson I learned from someone who did the same for me.
He took an oath, 'cause, well, it's a secret.
See, I've lived with my life as you have, serving a cause greater than myself, and I, too, took an oath.
After that I szore I'd never do anything just because everyone else was doing it.
My grandfather swore that he would never speak to my father again... nor to anyone else of his blood.
I swore I would never be a man like him, but I loved him and he was in danger.
